tafseer.tafsir: In these verses, Allah explains that if the sky is split open because the connection of its parts has been damaged with the destruction of the rules of the universe on the Day of Resurrection, it will be caused by the clash of stars in the sky because each has its own charm. Therefore, the order of the universe was broken and there were dark clouds that appeared in several places in outer space, and the sky would obey whatever God commanded. He deserves to be obedient because he is God's creature who is always in His power.

Furthermore, Allah explained that if the earth and mountains were crushed into pieces so that they became flat and released what was in their "stomach", then this was due to their submission to Allah's commands and obedience to do His will. In other verses, Allah says: When the earth is shaken with a violent shock, and the earth has released its heavy burdens (which it contains). (az-Zalzalah/99: 1-2) And when the graves are dismantled. (al-Infithar/82: 4) So doesn't he know when what is in the grave is taken out. (al-'Adiyat/100: 9) For the tafsir of the sentence "the sky split asunder" above, it can be seen again in the scientific study of surahh al-Insyiqaq/84:1-5, see also the scientific study of surahh al-haqqah/69:16 and surahh al-Infithar/82:1. Then, the sentence that follows: "¦and obeys his Lord, and naturally the heavens obey", implies that the incident took place according to sunatullah, that is, according to Allah's laws that exist in this universe. The definition of "the earth was flattened, and spewed out what was in it and became empty" is that the earth was completely destroyed, either in a collision with a planet or other celestial body, due to the loss or confusion of the gravitational force. The melting of the earth's desolation also causes the entire contents of the earth to vomit and makes the contents of the earth empty. Then, the sentence that follows: "¦and obeys his Lord, and the earth should obey", implies that the incident took place according to sunatullah, that is, according to Allah's laws that exist in this universe.

In this verse, Allah reveals that humans in their lifetime work earnestly to achieve their goals. Every human step actually leads to the end of his life, namely death. This means returning to God. Therefore, humans will know about the merits of the work they have done.

In these verses it is explained that those who receive notes with their right hand that contain everything they have done, then they will be accounted for easily and lightly. Describe all his good and bad deeds, then be rewarded for his good deeds and forgive his bad deeds. In a hadith the Prophet saw explained: From 'Aisyah, he said, "I heard the Messenger of Allah pray in some of the prayers he did, "O Allah, give me an easy reckoning." When the Apostle finished praying, I said: "O Prophet Allah, what is easy reckoning? The Messenger of Allah replied, "An easy reckoning is when Allah checks a person's deeds, He forgives. O 'Aisyah, the person who is interrogated on the calculation of his deeds on that day (Doomsday), then he is wretched. And every calamity that befalls a believer, Allah will forgive (his sin) with that disaster, even if it's just a thorn." (Ahmad's history) The meaning of the Messenger of Allah with an easy calculation was that all his mistakes were forgiven, while a person whose records were examined carefully was a person who received a disaster. Whoever gets an easy and light calculation, he will return to his believing family happily as Allah says: As for the person whose book is given in his right hand, he said, "Take it, read my book (this). Verily I am sure that (something when) I will receive an account against myself." Then that person is in a happy life. (al-haqqah/69: 19-21)

In these verses, Allah explains that the second group are those who do a lot of immoral acts, are disobedient, and do not please Allah. They will receive a record of their deeds with their left hand, and from the back, then they will be thrust into hell. And as for the person whose book is given in his left hand, he said, "It would be better if my book (this) was not given to me. So I don't know how my calculations are. Oh, I hope (death) is what ends everything. My wealth is completely useless to me. My power has gone from me." (al-haqqah/69: 25-29)

In these verses, Allah explains that there are two reasons why they accept their deeds with their left hand, namely: first, they do what they want, do evil and disobedience without thinking about the bad consequences that will befall them in the hereafter. Second, they think that they will not return to their Lord and will not be resurrected to be reckoned with and receive the results of their actions in this world.

In this verse, Allah confirms that they will actually return to Him and will receive the results of their deeds in this world. People who are pious and obedient to do His commandments will be put into heaven, while people who are disobedient and commit a lot of immorality will be put into hell.

In these verses, Allah swears by the red light at dusk, by the night and what is covered with it and by the moon when it becomes full moon that humans actually go through stages in life, from a drop of semen to being born. Then through childhood, youth and adulthood to old age. Then from life to death, then being resurrected, living again in heaven or hell after going through a very careful trial and calculation.

In this verse, Allah denounces their attitude and actions, "Why do they still not want to believe, while the evidence has clearly shown the existence of the day of resurrection?" God's Word: Those who disbelieve think they will not be resurrected. Say (Muhammad), "Not so, by my Lord, you will surely be resurrected, then all that you have done will be announced." And that is easy for Allah. (at-Tagabun/64: 7)

In this verse, Allah explains that they do not want to admit that the Qur'an is the divine word that must be glorified and obeyed and acknowledges that the Prophet Muhammad is actually the messenger of Allah.

In this verse, Allah explains that they do not want to admit that the Qur'an is the divine word that must be glorified and obeyed and acknowledges that the Prophet Muhammad is actually the messenger of Allah.

In the following verses, Allah explains why they did not want to admit it, namely: 1. They were jealous of the Prophet Muhammad for the advantages that Allah had given him. 2. They are afraid of losing their influence and position as leaders of their nation. 3. They don't want to replace the beliefs that have been held by their ancestors with other beliefs. Allah knows what they hide in their hearts. Therefore, Allah mocked them with the words, "Give them good news with a painful doom on the Day of Resurrection."

In this verse, Allah explains that those who believe in Allah and His Messenger, believe in the Qur'an, and work on its teachings to the best of their ability, will receive rewards from Allah that are uninterrupted, lasting forever. ever.
